title: gcc: use isl@0.14 for gcc@5
body:
My attempts to build `gcc@5.1.0:5.4.0` failed with errors similar to the following:

```
In file included from /home/mwoods/spack/var/spack/stage/gcc-5.1.0-az2fstmixudojmsw4bflopypa4yikc4i/gcc-5.1.0/gcc/graphite.c:88:
/home/mwoods/spack/var/spack/stage/gcc-5.1.0-az2fstmixudojmsw4bflopypa4yikc4i/gcc-5.1.0/gcc/graphite-poly.h:398: error: ‘isl_constraint’ has not been declared
/home/mwoods/spack/var/spack/stage/gcc-5.1.0-az2fstmixudojmsw4bflopypa4yikc4i/gcc-5.1.0/gcc/graphite-poly.h:402: error: variable or field ‘debug_isl_constraint’ declared void
/home/mwoods/spack/var/spack/stage/gcc-5.1.0-az2fstmixudojmsw4bflopypa4yikc4i/gcc-5.1.0/gcc/graphite-poly.h:402: error: ‘isl_constraint’ was not declared in this scope
/home/mwoods/spack/var/spack/stage/gcc-5.1.0-az2fstmixudojmsw4bflopypa4yikc4i/gcc-5.1.0/gcc/graphite-poly.h:402: error: expected primary-expression before ‘)’ token
```

According to https://gcc.gnu.org/ml/gcc-help/2015-10/msg00008.html, this is a known problem that can be resolved either by omitting isl from the build or by downgrading to a known-good version of isl.

I changed the gcc package to use `isl@0.14` for `gcc@5`, and my builds of `gcc@5.1.0:5.4.0` were then successful (using `%gcc@4.4.7` on RHEL6).
